alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thermopolis, Hot Springs State Park and Hot Springs County Fairgrounds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
